definition: lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
surname Yu
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
dragon/CL:條|条[tiao2]/imperial
surname Long
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
variant of 雜|杂[za2]
mixed/miscellaneous/various/to mix

sentences.english: At present Chinese innovation is a mixed bag.
sentences.chinese: 目前中国的创新“鱼龙混杂”。

sentences.english: The dragons and fishes jumbled together - the good and bad people were mixed together.
sentences.chinese: 《鱼龙混杂》是比喻坏人和好人混在一起。

definition: good and bad people intermingled
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
as many as the hair of the ox (idiom)/great amount of/countless
hard to distinguish real from imitation
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
(idiom) variable/uneven/irregular
all kinds of/all sorts of/every (different) kind of
mud and sand flow together (idiom)/good and bad mingle
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: bad money drives out good money (economics)
pinyin: lie4 bi4 qu1 zhu2 liang2 bi4

definition: chaos/madness

more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
